Pollster: GfK KnowledgePanel/Flores, A. R. et al (2020)
Notes: The wording of the question ("sex change") sets poll apart.
Question: Allowing students who have had a sex change to play college sports as a member of their current gender.
Answers: 1 (strongly agree) to 5 (strongly disagree)

Notes: Pg 6 of Topline. Specific to high school athletics. For the crosstabs, the dataset was downloaded and opened with JASP. Empty answers were filtered, and q12 was used as the variable, with party and sex used as splits
Question: Do you think a transgender student who was listed as male on their birth certificate, but now identifies as female, should be able to participate in high school athletic events with other female students?
Answers: Yes, should be allowed to participate. No, should not be allowed to participate. Don’t know/Refused

Notes: Poll start/end taken from https://nsass.org/
Question: Transgender athletes should be allowed to compete with their choice of male or female athletes.
Answers: 1 (strongly agree) to 4 (strongly disagree)

Question: Do you favor or oppose allowing transgender students to participate on the sports teams of the gender they identify with, letting biological males, for example, play girls' sports?
Answers: Not available (Presumably Support/Oppose/Undecided)

Notes: Another question asking about fairness was not used.
Question: Should competitive athletic teams in high schools and college allow transgender to play on the team of their stated sex or require them to play on the teams of their birth sex?
Answers: Allow to play on team of stated sex/Require to play on team of birth sex

Question: Do you favor or oppose allowing transgender students to participate on the sports teams of the gender they identify with, letting biological males, for example, play girls' sports?
Answers: Not available (Presumably Support/Oppose/Undecided)

Notes: This question was significantly different than other polls. Pgs 112 & 126 of crosstabs
Question: Should boys and men who say they identify as transgender be allowed to compete in girls’ and women’s athletics?
Answers: Strongly agree/Somwhat agree/Somewhat disagree/Strongly disagree/Unsure or No Opinion

Question: Do you favor or oppose allowing transgender students to participate on the sports teams of the gender they identify with, letting biological males, for example, play girls' sports?
Answers: Not available (Presumably Support/Oppose/Undecided)

Notes: Page 249
Question: As you may know, Mississippi is moving towards banning transgender athletes from participating on women’s sports teams at the state’s high schools and universities. Based on what you know, do you support or oppose banning transgender athletes from competing on women’s sports teams?
Answers: Strongly support/Somwhat support/Somewhat oppose/Strongly oppose/Don't know/No opinion

Notes: There was a question regarding legislation prohibiting athletes from joining teams that match their "gender identity". This was opposed by 67% - this was not used as the other question was more relevant. The data on high school and college was averaged. Data on "National Adults" was used (as opposed to voters).
Question: Do you think transgender students should or should not be allowed to play on sports teams that match their gender identity in high school? Do you think transgender students should or should not be allowed to play on sports teams that match their gender identity in college?
Answers: Should/Should not/Unsure

Notes: Page 5. Averages of responses for High School/College/Professional were used. There are many other questions in this polling that may be of interest.
Question: Do you support or oppose allowing transgender girls or women to compete against other female athletes at each of the following levels [High school sports, College sports, Professional sports]?
Answers: Strongly support/Somwhat support/Somewhat oppose/Strongly oppose/Don't know/No opinion

Notes: “The sample consists of approximately 1,000 individuals” in the U.S.
Question: To what extent do you support or oppose the following: Transgender athletes competing based on the gender they identify with rather the sex they were assigned at birth
Answers: Support/Oppose/Neutral

Question: Next, we have a question about policies for competitive sports that have separate teams for male and female athletes. Do you think transgender athletes – [ROTATED: should be able to play on sports teams that match their current gender identity (or) should only be allowed to play on sports teams that match their birth gender]?
Answers: Able to play on teams that match identity/Only on teams that match birth gender/No opinion

Pollster: Global Sport Institute at Arizona State University/OH Predictive Insights
Notes: Page 71. There are many other questions in this polling that may be of interest.
Question: Consider the following scenario: An athlete who was born with externally male sexual characteristics identifies as a woman and wants to compete as a woman. Should this be allowed?
Answers: I am strongly against it/I am somewhat against it/I am neutral/I somewhat support it/I strongly support it

Question: Is it fair to make women compete against transgender athletes?
Answers: Not available (Presumably Fair/Unfair/Undecided)

Notes: This had a response not found in other polls - “Not be allowed to compete”. Overall, the percents add up to 96, rounding? “Not be allowed to compete" was combined with Athletes of the gender they were assigned at birth.
Question: Do you think that transgender athletes should compete against...
Answers: Athletes of the gender with which they identify/Athletes of the gender they were assigned at birth/Not be allowed to compete/Don't know

Notes: The pollster has commentary comparing this poll to one from 2018 https://www.prri.org/research/most-americans-support-pro-lgbtq-policies-but-are-more-divided-over-transgender-sports-and-bathroom-policies/
Question: Allowing a transgender student who was listed as male on their birth certificate, but now identifies as female, to participate in high school athletic events with other female students. TODO: This says Wave 3 - there is only one other PRRI poll here, is there a missing one?

Answers: Strongly Support/Somewhat support/Neither/Somewhat oppose/Strongly Oppose
